content:
I am trying to get PR to pass and I am getting the error message

Warning: ./././Mathlib/Data/List/Lemmas.lean:7:1: warning: unused import (use `lake exe shake --fix` to fix this, or `lake exe shake --update` to ignore)
Warning: ./././Mathlib/Data/List/Lemmas.lean:8:1: warning: import #[Mathlib.Data.List.Basic] instead
./././Mathlib/Data/List/Lemmas.lean:
  remove #[Mathlib.Data.List.InsertNth]
  add #[Mathlib.Data.List.Basic]

But this is definitely wrong. There are lemmas in the new InsertNth file that are directly used in Lemmas.lean. Why is the linter making this mistake?
I'm just going to make a bug issue for this.

@Bolton Bailey, shake is not perfect, and often cannot see dependencies. As Mario said elsewhere recently, often this is just dsimp, where the lemmas used leave no trace in the proof term. But sometimes also notations and tactics confuse shake.

If you are sure it is wrong, please just run lake exe shake --update and commit the changes to noshake.json as part of the PR. No need for bug reports, usually. :-)
